oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.persistence.manager

Class RestPersistenceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.persistence.manager.AbstractPersistenceManager
      • oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.persistence.manager.AbstractRemotePersistenceManager
        • oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.persistence.manager.RestPersistenceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PersistenceManager, RemotePersistenceManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RestJSONPersistenceManager, RestXMLPersistenceManager
    Deprecated. 
    Use the class with same name in oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.v2.persistence.* instead

    public abstract class RestPersistenceManager
extends AbstractRemotePersistenceManager
    Abstract class that provides generic implementation of some of the methods of the PersistenceManager interface that can be used by concrete subclasses that use RESTful web services. Also provides helper methods that can be used by subclasses.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class oracle.ateam.sample.mobile.persistence.manager.AbstractRemotePersistenceManager

    • Method Detail

      • convertToStringValue

        protected java.lang.String convertToStringValue(AttributeMapping attrMapping,
                                                java.lang.Object value)
        Deprecated. 
        Convert object value to a string. If the value is a Date or TimeStamp the date and datetime format as defined against the dscriptor in persistenceMapping.xml is used to do the conversion. This method also includes a work around for bug 18523176: clearing number field in amx page sets the value to 0 instead of null. If the attribute is a BigDecimal or Integer and the value is 0, we now return null. Override this method if you do need to return "0".
        Parameters:
        attrMapping -
        value -
        Returns:

        Returns a map with as key the attribute name as used in the payload, and as value the string representation of the entity attribute value
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getRestNullValue

        public java.lang.String getRestNullValue()
        Deprecated. 
        Return the string that should be used to indicate a null value in Rest payload. Returns null by default. Returns '' in RestXMLPersistenceManager Override this method if you need a different null value. Note that the value "null" between quotes is translated to null without quotes in method RestJSONPersistenceManager.getSerializedDataObject to work around MAF bug 18523199
        Returns:

      • getMaxValue

        public java.lang.Object getMaxValue(java.lang.Class entityClass,

      • handleInvokeRestServiceError

        protected java.lang.String handleInvokeRestServiceError(java.lang.String requestType,
                                                        java.lang.String uri,
                                                        java.lang.Exception e)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is called when the REST service call returns a status other than 200. The default implementation is to throw an exception so calling method can take appropriate action, for example registering a pending data sync action. However, in some situations the returned status code might indicate a succesfull call. To handle such a situation, you need to overwrite this method and handle the reponse as needed.
        Parameters:
        requestType -
        uri -
        e -
        Returns:

      • handleWriteResponse

        protected void handleWriteResponse(Entity entity,
                                   Method method,
                                   java.lang.String action,
                                   java.lang.String response)
        Deprecated. 
        When the write action is not a remove action, this method assumes that the payload returned contains the inserted/updated entity instance and updates the entity and database row with the latest values as returned by the web service. If the payload is a different format, nothing will happen. Override this method to handle the specific format in which application specific errors are returned in response
        Parameters:
        entity -
        method -
        action -
        response -
